column4: dear all, i am here wondering how to deactivate the ATI/AMD propietary FGLRX graphics driver. My main problem is that I don't even get command line access when I boot. I am booting from usb...
I have same problem of yours, what's you card model?
It is whatever comes with the hp tm2t
I have ATI Radeon HD 5470 Intel HD Graphics embedded in core i3
I think it is a radeon hd 5450
oh, no, mine is not a core i3; it's the older version that came iwth a core 2 duo
ahaa, and I'm here to find a solution, but no one actually responds 0_0
one solution is to reinstall everything...
which i would leave for next week
i already tried that several times
what do you mean? you booted from usb and installed everything, asking the installer to format your drive, and you still had the driver installed afterwards?

I intalled the system, now when it comes to intall the ATI, which I install it manually by downloading the binary file, then after restarting my computer, system doesn't boot, and yes, I install it from USB which has nothing to do with our issue
believe me, you will enjoy your computer more if it works.
where is it? where can I get it from? what's the installation process?
i think i will try doing some stuff, but i must boot...
